title: Korean Fire-Grilled Chicken (Dak-Bulgogi)
description: This flavour-packed Korean recipe needs to find a place on your BBQ this summer â€¦ and every summer!
overview: Flavour-packed Korean fire-grilled chicken with a spicy kochujang dressing and fresh garnishes.

ingredients.title: Marinade
content: 1 small brown onion, peeled and quartered

ingredients.title: To Serve
content: Butter and red mignonette lettuce leaves (or your choice)
Kimchi (a must for every Korean meal!)
Korean mushrooms lightly grilled in Cobram Extra Virgin Olive Oil

stages.title: Step 1
content: Trim any excess fat off the chicken thigh fillets.

stages.title: Step 2
content: In a food processor, blitz the onion, ginger, and garlic until they form a smooth paste.

stages.title: Step 3
content: Place the onion, garlic, and ginger paste together with the remaining marinade ingredients. Mix until well combined. Add the chicken pieces and massage the marinade into them. Place in an airtight container and let marinate for at least 3 hours, though overnight is preferable.

stages.title: Step 4
content: Heat a charcoal barbecue until the coals are white hot. Place the marinated chicken fillets on an oiled grill rack. Cook on one side for at least 3 minutes, then carefully turn and cook for a further 3 minutes. Adjust time for thicker fillets.

stages.title: Step 5
content: Slice the thigh fillets into 1cm strips. Create lettuce parcels by placing a slice of pickled radish on a perilla leaf, then add the chicken strips and drizzle with some kochujang dressing. Serve immediately while hot.
